sfField.summary: External ID, used internally.

When set, this will be the SO Acknowledgement Address. Address must be valid as a Acknowledgement Address for the given SO Customer. When blank, will use the Customer's default Ackknowledgement Address.
For an add operation, if the sales order specified already exists then add lines to this order instead of generating an error.
When overriding Ship-To Address, enter desired Street Number and Street Name here.
When overriding Ship-To Address, enter desired unit number, suite number or other designation here.
When overriding Ship-To Address, enter desired designation here.
When checked, creates a Ship-To Override Address using the SYDATA address info entered (see address fields below). Use in API Modes = Add Header, Add Both, Change Header or Change Both.
When checked and transaction is to Create Invoice, the given invoice will be added to the current open Invoice Batch
The Alternative inventory item to associate with a new sales order line. The field accepts the item number.

When checked, record will be processed "in background", meaning that it will process when Periodic Batch Processor cycles. Note that if field is set & does not process within a few minutes, it may be that Periodic Batch Processor needs to be restarted.
When set, this will be the SO Bill To Address. Address must be valid as a Bill To Address for the given SO Customer. When blank, will use the Customer's default Bill To Address.
When API Mode is "Change Header", when this is checked, the Sales Order will be cancelled. Note that the 'Cancelled Reason' field must also be set when this field is checked.
When cancelling a Sales Order, this field is required
When set, this value will be used for the SO Header Carrier. If not set, the Carrier will be set from the RS Customer Master default.
If checked then the value in the SOAPI Carrier field will be used to populate the sales order line carrier field rather than the sales order header carrier field.
sfField.t: Use Carrier on Sales Order Line

sfField.summary: When creating a Sales Order from a SF Case, this field is automatically set. This field may also be set when inserting the SOAPI record directly, and must be a valid SF Case.
When overriding Ship-To Address, enter desired City here.
When using API Mode = Change Line, when this is checked, the Case field on the specified SO Line will be cleared.
If set then the Opportunity field in the sales order header and/or sales order line will be cleared.
When using API Mode = Change Line, if this field is checked, the Covered Item field on the SO Line will be cleared.
When checked and API Mode = Change Header, the Sales Order specified will be closed. Note that all lines must be shipped or canceled in order to close a Sales Order.

When overriding Ship-To Address, enter Contact Method for the override Contact. Options are

Email
Phone
Fax
Text to Email
Test to Phone

When adding a SO to be associated with a Contract, this field must be set with an active valid Contract for the given Customer. Note that when used, other Contract-based rules apply, such as forcing products and/or pricing to match Contract parameters.
When set, this is the Cost of Sales Account used on the resulting SO Line. If not set, the normal default logic is used.
When overriding Ship-To Address, enter desired Country here.
Can use this field to specify the Customer Number as an alternative to setting the Customer (Lookup) field to identify the Sales Order Customer.
When set, this is written to the Customer PO field on the SO Header being added or changed
When set, this is written to the Customer Reference field on the SO Header being added or changed
When using API Mode = Delete Line, when this is checked, all lines for the given SO will be deleted
When checked, deletes a previously created Ship-To Override Address. Use in API Modes = Change Header or Change Both.
When set, this is used as the SO Line Discount and overrides any pre-defined default that would otherwise be used
When set, this will be used as the SO Line Due Date and overrides the normal calculated value
When overriding Ship-To Address, enter appropriate email address for the override Contact.
When checked, the resulting SO Header will have the 'Contract Equipment Sale' checked.
When some validation rule or data issue does not allow this record to be successfully processed, the appropriate error message is written here
If record is for a RS Quote, this is the date that said quote expires
User-defined header-level (applies to entire Sales Order) comments to print on SO Acknowledgement (and other documents) that are intended to be read by the Sales Order Customer.
User-defined line-level comments to print on SO Acknowledgement (and other documents) that are intended to be read by the Sales Order Customer.
System-generated extended error message, set as applicable.
When overriding Ship-To Address, enter appropriate fax number for the override Contact.
When adding a SO Line for a Product and the default for said Product is to add at a Unfirm status, by checking this checkbox, it will override said logic and add the SO Line at a Firm status.
When set, this overrides the normal default logic for setting the Header FOB
If set, this is used to set the SO Line Freight Amount
If set, this overrides the normal default logic for setting Header Freight Terms
On the add of a SO Line, this can be set so that upon the save of this record, a SYDATA record is automatically created to execute the fulfillment of said SO Line.

For Sales Orders created from SOAPI asynchronously via the SYDATA Process Bulk SOAPIs transaction, this field causes a single Fulfillment SYDATA to be spawned after the order creation (vs. individual fulfillments done via SOAPI_FULFILL)
This field carries the additional/alternate Order Payment Gateway #1
This field carries the additional/alternate Order Payment Gateway #2
This field carries the additional/alternate Order Payment Gateway #3
This field carries the additional/alternate Order Payment Gateway #4
This field carries the additional/alternate Order Payment Gateway #5
This field carries the additional/alternate Order Payment Gateway #6
This field carries the additional/alternate Order Payment Gateway #7
This field carries the additional/alternate Order Payment Gateway #8
This field carries the additional/alternate Order Payment Gateway #9
If set, this is used to set the SO Line Handling Amount
When using API Mode = Add Header or Change Header, enter value for the Freight Amount total for the entire SO, overriding any summation from SO Lines.
When using API Mode = Add Header or Change Header, enter value for the Handling Amount total for the entire SO, overriding any summation from SO Lines.
When set, this value is used as the Sales Order discount that applies to the entire Sale Order total
When using API Mode = Add Header or Change Header, enter value for the Packaging Amount total for the entire SO, overriding any summation from SO Lines.

When set, this will be the SO Installation Address. Address must be valid as a Installation Address for the given SO Installation Customer. When blank, will use the Installation Customer's default Installation Address.

When set, this is used as the SO Installation Customer. Note that value needs to be a valid Related Customer for the given SO Customer. If not set, the SO Customer is used as the Installation Customer.
User-defined SO Header Internal Comments (which do not print on SO Acknowledgement).
User-defined SO Line Internal Comments (which do not print on SO Acknowledgement).
When checked, indicates that this record was spawned from a Inter-System (between Companies) Purchase Order.
When checked, indicates that this record was spawned from a Intra-Company (between Divisions) Purchase Order.
When set, will be used as the Inventory Division for the SO Line being added

When adding a SO Line and checking the Fulfill Order Line field (which spawns a corresponding SYDATA), when this field is checked, a SYDATA will be spawned upon the order fulfillment that will in turn create the Sales Invoice for that fulfillment.

When setting the 'Create Invoice' field to checked and all shipped SO Lines are to be invoiced for the stated SO, check this checkbox. When the SYDATA is spawned to create the invoice, this setting will be carried over the that SYDATA record.
sfField.t: Invoice all Shippers for this Order

sfField.summary: International Organization for Standardization (ISO) assigned Country Code applicable for the override Ship-To Address.
When checked when adding an order, the order will be added as a RS Quote
Used internally, don't set manually. Marks that the soapi object is being processed as part of a bulk operation.
When set, will be used as the Inventory Division for the SO Line being added. This is the lookup field so needs to be valid Division (and an existing Inventory Div for the SO Line Product).

The Sales Order Line Number. If adding a line, this can be set to the line number desired, otherwise the system will set it. When doing a Change or Delete for a SO Line, this identifies the SO Line affected.
When checked and API Mode is Change Line, the specified Sales Order Line will be canceled.
When set, value is used to set the Installation Address on the specified SO Line. If not set, the standard default logic is used for setting the value on the SO Line.

sfField.relationshipLabel: Sales Order APIs (Line Ship To Address)
sfField.summary: When set, value is used to set the Ship To Address on the specified SO Line. If not set, the standard default logic is used for setting the value on the SO Line.

Mode/function for this transaction. Options are

Add Header
Add Line
Add Both
Change Header
Change Line
Change Both
Delete Header
Delete Line
Delete Both
This field allows for the Sales Order Line to be added or updated with the Suppress Creation Direct Purchase Orders indicator set to FALSE
This field allows for the Sales Order Line to be added or updated with the Suppress Creation Direct Purchase Orders indicator set to TRUE
If the given Product or Customer is tax exempt but it is desired that this Sales Order Line is to be taxed, set this field to checked.
The Id of an opportunity, if not blank then the value will assigned to the sales order header and/or the sales order line depending on the mode.
When adding a SO and the Order Date is to be something other than TODAY, set the desired date here.

When adding a SO and auto-numbering of said order is not desired, set this field to desired value. Note that when using user-defined order #s, the # must start with an alpha character.\n\nIf doing a change or delete, field can be used to reference the SO#
This field carries the amount to be used with the additional/alternate Order Payment Gateway #1
This field carries the amount to be used with the additional/alternate Order Payment Gateway #2
This field carries the amount to be used with the additional/alternate Order Payment Gateway #3
This field carries the amount to be used with the additional/alternate Order Payment Gateway #4
This field carries the amount to be used with the additional/alternate Order Payment Gateway #5
This field carries the amount to be used with the additional/alternate Order Payment Gateway #6
This field carries the amount to be used with the additional/alternate Order Payment Gateway #7
This field carries the amount to be used with the additional/alternate Order Payment Gateway #8
This field carries the amount to be used with the additional/alternate Order Payment Gateway #9
When using a "payment processing" gateway (like with Service Provider PayPal), this is the amount to be either authorized or payed via said Service Provider
When using a "payment processing" gateway and Authorization and/or Payments are processed using SOAPI, this is the resulting Transaction ID from the given Service Provider
When checked, indicates that this order has been authorized by the "payment processing" Service Provider used (e.g., PayPal)
When checked, indicates that this order has already been paid by the "payment processing" Service Provider used (e.g., PayPal)
When set, will use this value to set Order Type on SO Header
If set, this is used to set the SO Line Packaging Amount
When overriding Ship-To Address, enter appropriate phone number for the override Contact.
Enter a valid Project Charge Code for the SO Line Project being charged.
When record is inserted for a Inter- or Intra-Sytem Purchase Order, spawning the add of a Sales Order, this is originating PO Line
When checked, indicates a Contract-related SO has been validated against the given Sales Contract.
When set, this will override any other price look-ups and will be used as the Unit Price on the SO Line
Enter appropriate valid active Rootstock Price Book to be used. When setting this field, you need to select an appopriate option in the 'Price Book Option' field.

When using Rootstock Price Book, enter applicable option. Options are

Write to SO Header (written to SO Header and applies to all lines)
Write to SO Line (written to SO Line and only applies to the given line)

When set, this is used as the SO Pricing Customer. Note that value needs to be a valid Related Customer for the given SO Customer. IMPORTANT: When set, pricing look-ups will be based on the Pricing Customer rather than the SO Customer.
When checked, indicates that this record has been successfully processed
When a value is entered here, a lookup is done to the Customer Product record to derive the Rootstock Product Number.
The RS Product being ordered on the given SO Line
When set, this is the Default Project set on the SO Header
The SO Line's Project value. If not specified, the Home Project for the given Inventory Division will be used.
The order quantity for the SO Line being added or changed
This field provides a reference field where the source quotation can be recorded on the sales order header.

Used to update the SO Line Required Date (which is the date used for inventory "readiness"). This field may only be used to change existing lines (not in new mode) and only when allowed by the Sales Control setting "Manual Control Over SO Line Dates".
Once a SOAPI record is saved, if there is an error, once the error condition is corrected, check this checkbox so the the processing engine knows to retry processing this record.
Check this checkbox to reverse the cancellation of a cancelled Sales Order
In order to re-open a closed Sales Order, use API Mode = Change Header and check this checkbox and the specified Sales Order will be re-opened.
If a Sales Order Line has been canceled and now you wish to "un-cancel" it, check checkbox and the SO Line specified will be re-opened.
When set, this is the Sales Account (aka Revenue Account) used on the resulting SO Line. If not set, the normal default logic is used.
The Sales Division in which the given SO is added under

Used to update the SO Line Scheduled Ship Date (the date when the product is to be shipped). This field may only be used to change existing lines (not in new mode) and only when allowed by the Sales Control setting â€œManual Control Over SO Line Dates".
When set, this value will be used to set the Ship-From Location ID on the given SO Line. If not set, the normal default logic for setting Ship-From Location ID will be used.

When set, value is used to set Ship-From Location No on the SO Line. If not set, the normal default logic for setting Ship-From Loc No is used. Note that if using pre-defined Location Numbers in the given Site, must be valid Location No for Loc ID used.
When set, this value will be used to set the Ship-From Site on the given SO Line. If not set, the normal default logic for setting Ship-From Site will be used.
When set, value is used to set the Ship To Address on SO Header. If not set, the standard default logic is used for setting the value.
If set, this overrides the normal default logic for setting Header Shipment Method. Note that the relationship between the given carrier and the Shipment Method used must exist.
If checked then the value in the SOAPI Carrier field will be used to populate the sales order line ship-via field rather than the sales order header ship-via field.
sfField.t: Use ShipVia on Sales Order Line

sfField.summary: The Customer used on the Sales Order being created.
The Payment Gateway used to authorize and/or pay via the "payment processing" Service Provider (e.g., PayPal)
When referencing an existing Sales Order, enter a valid SO here
When referencing an existing Sales Order Line, enter a valid SO Line here
The RS Product being ordered on the given SO Line
When adding a SO Line and this is set, the Covered Item field on the SO Line will be set to this value. Must be a valid Shipped Item Warranty record.
The Sales Division in which the given SO is added under
When overriding Ship-To Address, enter desired State or Province here.
When 'Add Ship To Address Override' is checked (set to TRUE), enter Name of Address desired.
The Manufacturing User that "caused" the insert of this record (if spawned from another process or inserted directly).
This field contains the VAT Class to be used on this Sales Order Line.

This field carries the tax amount to be used on the Sales Order Line being added (or updated) via this transaction record. This amount is used in place of any system calculated amount that would normally be used.
If the given Product or Customer is not tax exempt but it is desired that this Sales Order Line is not to be taxed, set this field to checked.
Given that tax rates are based on the location receiving the goods, when overriding Ship-To Address, enter appropriate predefined Tax Location here.
This field is used to indicate that the Sales Order Line being added (or updated) via this transaction record will be given an override tax amount.
This field is used to indicate that the Sales Order Line being updated via this transaction record is to have its Tax Override removed.
If set, this overrides the normal default logic for setting Payment Terms
When checked, rather than updating the error field, any failure/error will throw error exceptions
When adding a SO Line for a Product and the default for said Product is to add at a Firm status, by checking this checkbox, it will override said logic and add the SO Line at a Unfirm status.
When using customer custom fields, if you wish to override the existing value, check checkbox. Applies to Change Header or Change Line API Mode. Enter override value in desired Custom Field field.

When adding a SO & multiple lines, because the user doesn't know what the SO # will be for additional lines to be added, enter a "Upload Group" on each line being added in a batch. This allows the code to understand they are to be added to the same SO.
When adding a SO Line for a Stock Product and this field is checked, the SO Line will be treated like a Configured Product, generating a Work Order when the SO Line is firmed.
When processing an SOAPI that affects the sales order header then if this flag is true then the Responsible User field on the sales order header (SOHDR_RESP) will be set to the value of SOAPI_SYUSR.
sfField.t: Use Mfg. User as Order Responsible User

sfField.summary: Can be set to the User Number of the Mfg User creating the given record

When adding a SO Line for a Configured Product and field is checked, the SO Line will be treated like a Stock Product & a Work Order will NOT be generated when SO Line is firmed (the assumption being that "stock this time" is due to having inventory OH.
When set, will use this value to set User Status on SO Header
Not Applicable
If other records (Customer Master, Product pricing records, etc.) have a default discount % defined for a SO Line, check this checkbox if no discount is to be derived (will be set to 0).
When checked, any Freight Amount on the specified SO Line will be set to $0.
When checked, any Handling Amount on the specified SO Line will be set to $0.
If other records (e.g., Customer Master) have a default discount % defined for a SO Header, check this checkbox if no discount is to be derived (will be set to 0).
When checked, any Freight Amount entered or rolled up from SO Lines will be set to $0.
When checked, any Handling Amount entered or rolled up from SO Lines will be set to $0.
When checked, any Packaging Amount entered or rolled up from SO Lines will be set to $0.
When checked, any Packaging Amount on the specified SO Line will be set to $0.
When overriding Ship-To Address, enter desired Zip Code or Postal Code here.
This field holds (one of up to twelve) Lot Numbers to be used when the associated Sales Order Line is fulfilled (paired with the corresponding Ordered Lot Quantity field).
This field holds (one of up to twelve) Lot Numbers to be used when the associated Sales Order Line is fulfilled (paired with the corresponding Ordered Lot Quantity field).
This field holds (one of up to twelve) Lot Numbers to be used when the associated Sales Order Line is fulfilled (paired with the corresponding Ordered Lot Quantity field).
This field holds (one of up to twelve) Lot Numbers to be used when the associated Sales Order Line is fulfilled (paired with the corresponding Ordered Lot Quantity field).
This field holds (one of up to twelve) Lot Numbers to be used when the associated Sales Order Line is fulfilled (paired with the corresponding Ordered Lot Quantity field).
This field holds (one of up to twelve) Lot Numbers to be used when the associated Sales Order Line is fulfilled (paired with the corresponding Ordered Lot Quantity field).
This field holds (one of up to twelve) Lot Numbers to be used when the associated Sales Order Line is fulfilled (paired with the corresponding Ordered Lot Quantity field).
This field holds (one of up to twelve) Lot Numbers to be used when the associated Sales Order Line is fulfilled (paired with the corresponding Ordered Lot Quantity field).
This field holds (one of up to twelve) Lot Numbers to be used when the associated Sales Order Line is fulfilled (paired with the corresponding Ordered Lot Quantity field).
This field holds (one of up to twelve) Lot Numbers to be used when the associated Sales Order Line is fulfilled (paired with the corresponding Ordered Lot Quantity field).
This field holds (one of up to twelve) Lot Numbers to be used when the associated Sales Order Line is fulfilled (paired with the corresponding Ordered Lot Quantity field).
This field holds (one of up to twelve) Lot Numbers to be used when the associated Sales Order Line is fulfilled (paired with the corresponding Ordered Lot Quantity field).

This field holds the quantity associated with (one of up to twelve) Lot Numbers to be used when the associated Sales Order Line is fulfilled. Note that the Ordered Lot Quantity is in the Inventory UOM.

This field holds the quantity associated with (one of up to twelve) Lot Numbers to be used when the associated Sales Order Line is fulfilled. Note that the Ordered Lot Quantity is in the Inventory UOM.

This field holds the quantity associated with (one of up to twelve) Lot Numbers to be used when the associated Sales Order Line is fulfilled. Note that the Ordered Lot Quantity is in the Inventory UOM.

This field holds the quantity associated with (one of up to twelve) Lot Numbers to be used when the associated Sales Order Line is fulfilled. Note that the Ordered Lot Quantity is in the Inventory UOM.

This field holds the quantity associated with (one of up to twelve) Lot Numbers to be used when the associated Sales Order Line is fulfilled. Note that the Ordered Lot Quantity is in the Inventory UOM.

This field holds the quantity associated with (one of up to twelve) Lot Numbers to be used when the associated Sales Order Line is fulfilled. Note that the Ordered Lot Quantity is in the Inventory UOM.

This field holds the quantity associated with (one of up to twelve) Lot Numbers to be used when the associated Sales Order Line is fulfilled. Note that the Ordered Lot Quantity is in the Inventory UOM.

This field holds the quantity associated with (one of up to twelve) Lot Numbers to be used when the associated Sales Order Line is fulfilled. Note that the Ordered Lot Quantity is in the Inventory UOM.

This field holds the quantity associated with (one of up to twelve) Lot Numbers to be used when the associated Sales Order Line is fulfilled. Note that the Ordered Lot Quantity is in the Inventory UOM.

This field holds the quantity associated with (one of up to twelve) Lot Numbers to be used when the associated Sales Order Line is fulfilled. Note that the Ordered Lot Quantity is in the Inventory UOM.

This field holds the quantity associated with (one of up to twelve) Lot Numbers to be used when the associated Sales Order Line is fulfilled. Note that the Ordered Lot Quantity is in the Inventory UOM.

This field holds the quantity associated with (one of up to twelve) Lot Numbers to be used when the associated Sales Order Line is fulfilled. Note that the Ordered Lot Quantity is in the Inventory UOM.
